High DPI screens

In latest versions of windows, screen resolution and zoom can be configured. When zoom is higher than 100%, some conflicts may appear between an application in C# and some API internal libraries like SFML. When this happens, the application running the API may suffer from involuntary elements size changes.

To avoid this, the API is configured as "DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT_UNAWARE" https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/api/winuser/nf-winuser-setprocessdpiawarenesscontext

Under this configuration, the screen size considered by the API may be different from the screen size considered by the application. To void error when working with custom GUIs and mouse event, all the callbacks in the API related to screen coordinates contain the screen point but also the screen size considered by the API. Whith the screen size, the application can normalize the screen point, and the use its own screen metrics.

It is good practise to normalize all the coordinates coming from the API to avoid screen resolutions mismatches.
